bibl.title: Letter from W.H. Hoffman to George A. Kellogg, February 9, 1942

div1.p: Hoffmann informs Kellogg that he has not yet received the reprints.

div1.head: Letter from W.H. Hoffman to George A. Kellogg, February 9, 1942
div1.opener:
cc to Dr. Hench
cc to file
original to Mr. Hodgman
Habana, Cuba,9, Febr. '42
Cerro 1381
Dear Mr. Kellogg:
div1.p:
Referring to your kind letter G.A.K.:L.
of 20 Jan '42, I beg to say that the 200 copies of the
picture, “Conquerors of Yellow Fever”" did not yet reach
me. I believe however that they will come parcel post
from U.S.A. always takes a good while before they reach
Habana.

A few days ago I had the visit of your
distributor in Cuba; he told me that he has received 1700
copies for distribution in Cuba; but he does not know any-
thing about the 200 copies which you had kindly reserved
for me. I did not want mine for distribution in Cuba;
since I have dedicated more than 40 years to Tropical Med-
icine, and travelled all over the tropical world, I have
friendship with all the specialists in other countries, and
it is to them that I want to send the copies, together with
personal letters and reprints of my own papers on yellow
fever, to which I have exclusively dedicated my whole life
since 25 years.

I am are that all my colleagues will be
greatly interested in the very beautiful picture which you
published. I have also taken some photos of the little
wooden hut in which the experiments of the Commission were
realized and which has already been published by Dr. Hench
With my best wishes and compliments.
